title: Abiky
author: Abiky
content: It seems that the persistent bear market drastically reduced ETH's network congestion. Gas fees have been ranging as low as 17 Gwei to 30 Gwei on average. The native cryptocurrency Ether (ETH) has been declining like crazy in Fiat terms, so it would be a lot cheaper to buy NFTs or do other network operations than before.Assuming ETH doesn't go any lower in price, would now be a great time to get in? Or should I wait a little longer? Do you think gas fees will soar back up again after the crypto winter settles? Your input will be greatly appreciated. Thanks.

comments.author: Ararbermas
comments.body: It would be a great idea to keep monitoring the growth rate of eth because surely the gas fees will be affected as well and you can get more cheaper fees when buying erc20 token. Infact the market still not fine so probably there will be more changes soon.

comments.author: Jatiluhung
comments.body: I myself am still waiting and watching. But so as not to be left behind. I keep buying gradually. and also be prepared if the decline continues by installing a buying net at several spot or support points. continuing to collect makes me calmer. although panic sometimes always comes when there is a long decline and even I panic when there is a rapid increase. because I'm not used to it. So to anticipate panic I prefer to enter little by little in this ETH coin.

I have bought ethereum when the price already down even lower than 1k and i got decent return in a week. Im sure that recovery can happen anytime. Buying at the bottom has become the best opportunity for anytone. WIll you try to miss this golden chance to get cheap ethereum from the market?

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: Quote from: Abiky on June 27, 2022, 12:51:41 AMDo you think gas fees will soar back up again after the crypto winter settles? Your input will be greatly appreciated. Thanks. Yes definitely. Crypto winters let these gas gee back down a little but thats because many havent using the network unlike the bear market. But surely it will go up once this bear situation gone. Every other L1 also got lowered transaction fees and thats mean a decrease in usage or users. Bull market will take time but as it recovered slowly the fee will increase likely directly proportional to the market movement.

comments.author: LogitechMouse
comments.body: Quote from: Abiky on June 27, 2022, 12:51:41 AMAssuming ETH doesn't go any lower in price, would now be a great time to get in? Or should I wait a little longer? Do you think gas fees will soar back up again after the crypto winter settles? Your input will be greatly appreciated. Thanks. I see Ethereum as the 2nd best long term coin to hold aside from Bitcoin so I think anytime would be a good time to buy Ethereum. Well, it's better if investors will buy now that we are in a crypto winter or bear market or whatever people may call to it.There are no changes or updates in Ethereum for a long time that affects it's gas fee aside from the EIP1559. Ethereum 2.0 might reduce it's gas fees by a little but we might still experience some high gas fees overtime in the future. Gas fees will soar up again for sure as many investors will come back again and invest. Many new projects will come again and develop under different smart contract platforms and that includes Ethereum.

You mean to invest? of course, good time to get in as the price is very cheap. comments.author: fuguebtc
comments.body: We won't be able to know where the bottom of the bears is this time, instead of waiting, the best method is DCA, that way we won't have to miss any opportunities. Personally, I also buy some coins when bitcoin falls below 18k, and I will hold on to those even though I'm now profitable. As of now, I just aim to hold as much as possible. I mostly buy on centralized exchanges and transfer to my hard wallet, so I am not concerned with the ETH fees at all. As long as the price drops I will place a buy order.

comments.author: bonyaserg
comments.body: Now that the payment for gas in the Ethereum network has begun to fall in price, there is an amazing opportunity to trade and send funds in the Ethereum network. And it follows that now investors can take advantage of this network since the commissions on the Ethereum network are the lowest, and now everyone is really looking for the right time and ways to pay lower gas commissions when trading on the network.

comments.body: Personally I think this is suitable time to buy Ethereum blockchain based NFTs and some quality tokens as we can see the current gas fees of Ethereum network is quite cheap and I don't think it may go more down although the dull market conditions may leave more impact on gas fees of Ethereum network nevertheless if you have found this time perfect to use Ethereum blockchain then you must consider to use it now maybe the gas price will go up in future.

comments.body: Quote from: Abiky on June 27, 2022, 12:51:41 AM(...)Assuming ETH doesn't go any lower in price, would now be a great time to get in? Or should I wait a little longer? Do you think gas fees will soar back up again after the crypto winter settles? Your input will be greatly appreciated. Thanks. If that happens, it's a great opportunity to buy and think profitably. But it's fair to say here we're in a complicated phase of the market where things are still down in a bear market. Although they might recover in the short term, as far as safety is concerned, I don't need to go too far in a rush to take risks in a period when everything fluctuates sharply in the negative direction.

comments.author: 2tang

Infact the market still not fine so probably there will be more changes soon.It will all be worth the price too, because when the price of Ethereum starts to decline in the market, the transaction fees on the Ethereum network will also decrease although not by a very large size, as well as when the price of Ethereum starts to increase, the transaction fees on the network will also increase. So obviously it takes time to monitor this so that everyone who wants to make transactions on the Ethereum network can know when transaction fees are low.

I remember the old time somewhere on 2018 when it's too low and many still didn't bought at that price.
